body:
On Tue, Dec 15, 2015 at 7:35 PM, Alex Brainman <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> 386 always passes argument on stack
>
> Do you have reference for that? I am specifically asking about float args.
>
No, the MS docs on this matter is very vague:
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/984x0h58.aspx
You probably have to find that out with experiments.

But there really is no reason to pass FP arguments in 387 stack whereas all
the integer arguments are passed on stack. (cdecl and stdcall)
